questionText: What is a function parameter in the C language?
options: The actual value passed to the function when it is called
A variable declared in the function header to receive arguments
The result returned by the function
The name of the function
The data type returned by the function
The statement that calls the function
A variable declared inside the function body
The actual value passed to the function when it is called
A random value

questionText: How should an argument be passed to a function to allow the function to change its original value?
options: Pass by value.
Pass by pointer.
Declare the parameter as a constant.
Use a global variable.

questionText: What is the purpose of the const keyword when declaring a pointer parameter?
options: To make the pointer itself constant
To prevent modification of the data pointed to
To speed up the function's execution
To make the parameter mandatory

questionText: Which of the following statements about passing arguments in C are true? (Choose all that apply)
options: Pass by value means the function receives a copy of the argument
C supports pass by reference like C++
Pass by pointer allows a function to modify the original value of a variable
Parameters declared with const cannot be used inside the function.
correctAnswers: Pass by value means the function receives a copy of the argument
Pass by pointer allows a function to modify the original value of a variable

questionText: How does pass by value differ from pass by pointer?
options: Pass by value is faster for large data structures
Both methods are completely identical in functionality
Pass by value allows modifying the original arguments
Pass by pointer avoids copying large amounts of data
The address of variable num

questionText: Write the prototype for a function named calculate that takes a pointer to an integer and returns no value.
Why is it recommended to check if a pointer is NULL before using it inside a function?
options: It speeds up the program
The compiler requires this check
To avoid undefined behavior when dereferencing
The function will not compile without the check
